body:
Karma

Rating: T just to be safe

Characters: Midoriya Izuku | Deku, Togata Mirio | Lemillion

Relationships: None

Additional Tags: Angst, Hurt no Comfort, Izuku is quirkless again, Mirio gets One for All

Summary: In a universe where Chisaki’s drug does really permanently erase a quirk, Mirio wasn’t the only one hit by it.

One for All can’t be forcefully taken, but it can be blocked from being used. Midoriya Izuku, quirkless again, could only think this had to be karma.

“If I told you I could give you my quirk senpai… would you accept it?”

Mirio stared at the teen in front of him, and let silence fall between them after the ringing of the question faded from the air.

This Midoriya… This wasn’t the same boy he’d gotten to know these past days. The normally bright and expressive teen was now blank faced, the spark that normally lit his eyes gone. Mirio could understand why, and he had been about to ignore his own state of mind and try to return the smile to the teen’s face when the question threw him for a loop.

In any other situation, he would have immediately said no. Told him that the lack of a quirk wouldn’t stop him from trying, and if he took the quirk then Midoriya would be quirkless, wouldn’t he? He didn’t want to subject the promising hero to that.

But this wasn’t any other situation. Midoriya had been hit by the drug, meaning that he was as quirkless as himself now. So how…?

Likely sensing his confusion, Midoriya started to talk. But instead of explaining what he meant, he began to tell him a story about two brothers: the elder had the ability to give and take quirks (Mirio made the connection instantly, but didn’t interrupt), while the younger was weak and quirkless.

The elder brother was a monster, using his quirk to control thousands of people. He tried to control his little brother, but he refused to obey. So as a final resort, the elder forced on his brother a power that was useless to him: the ability to stockpile power. The elder brother believed that his younger brother would then stop resisting him and join his cause.

But the younger brother wasn’t quirkless after all. He had an invisible quirk: the ability to pass his quirk to another. Merged with the stockpiling quirk, it created a unique power: One for All, a quirk that could be passed to another person.

Midoriya continued the tale, explaining how the quirk had passed from one user to another, gathering power with one goal: to defeat the elder brother.

There had been nine users so far. All Might was the eighth. Midoriya was the ninth.

And he wanted Mirio to be the tenth.

“You have to understand, senpai,” Midoriya continued in the same calm, blank tone he’d been using since he started talking, “that because of its nature One for All can’t be forcefully taken. Meaning that the drug didn’t erase it — it just blocked my body from accessing it. But it’s still there.” The blankness in Midoriya’s eyes was then replaced by a focused look, a look that begged Mirio to listen, to understand, as he said, “I can pass it on. I can give it to you, Mirio-senpai. That way, All Might’s hard work and legacy wouldn’t be wasted. That way, the world will still have their Symbol of Peace. So please senpai, take it. Take One for All and return being Lemillion: the hero who will save a million people.”

And after such an passionate speech, after Midoriya’s green eyes were all but begging him to agree, Mirio couldn’t say no. And a selfish part of him didn’t want to say no anyway — he’d been destroyed when he lost his quirk, even if he didn’t show it, but with Midoriya’s quirk he could have everything returned to him. He could be Lemillion again.

He wanted that. So he said yes.

***

After giving Mirio his quirk, Izuku sneaked out of the hospital and went to a nearby park, which was empty at those hours.

Staring at the darkening sky, and with the trees as the only witnesses, he finally let his tears fall.

Of course he would become quirkless again. Of course. He had been just fooling himself thinking he could be a hero.

This had to be Karma. There was no other explanation. This was the Universe telling him that he was never meant to have a quirk. Never meant to enter UA. Never meant to make the friends he had.

Never meant to be a hero.

He was meant to be nothing. He’d fooled himself by thinking he was the Deku who could do it… but he was just useless Deku after all, wasn’t he? Kacchan had told him repeatedly, but he’d refused to believe it. Now, he had no choice but to accept it. After all, even All Might had said it.

Young man without a quirk… You can’t become a hero.

It had to be Karma.

title: Got any headcanon requests?
body: I know I’m working on a couple of stories over on AO3, but I’d love to do a few headcanons over here on Tumblr. Don’t be shy, I take Anons. If you have any requests then hit me up on my ask page~

blog.description: ☆ Welcome to BNHA Source!  We are a fansite dedicated to the animanga Boku No Hero Academia created by Kōhei Horikoshi. Here you will find artworks and edits of the anime and manga, along with news updates. We track the tag #bnhasource and #bnhaedit. ♥

Summary:

A soft-spoken ecology major. A girl with a soft heart. A brooding, edgy boy. The three of them had nothing in common - that is, until a clever raven flew into their lives. (Day 2: Animals/Unlikely Friends)

blog.description: ☆ Welcome to BNHA Source!  We are a fansite dedicated to the animanga Boku No Hero Academia created by Kōhei Horikoshi. Here you will find artworks and edits of the anime and manga, along with news updates. We track the tag #bnhasource and #bnhaedit. ♥

tags: i have wanted this hairstyle since i saw this woman but my hair is too tin to pull it off...
but uraraka would look so amazing with it
summary: i keep seeing amazingly bad ass art is uraraka with some kind of undercut. and i’m all here for that. but let me suggest a...
body:
i keep seeing amazingly bad ass art is uraraka with some kind of undercut. and i’m all here for that. but let me suggest a particular style. here, please take my poorly edited gif

urarala with this sweet ass hair style would rock my whole world.

reblog.comment:
i keep seeing amazingly bad ass art is uraraka with some kind of undercut. and i’m all here for that. but let me suggest a particular style. here, please take my poorly edited gif

urarala with this sweet ass hair style would rock my whole world.

trail.content_raw:
i keep seeing amazingly bad ass art is uraraka with some kind of undercut. and i’m all here for that. but let me suggest a particular style. here, please take my poorly edited gif

urarala with this sweet ass hair style would rock my whole world.
trail.content:
i keep seeing amazingly bad ass art is uraraka with some kind of undercut. and i’m all here for that. but let me suggest a particular style. here, please take my poorly edited gif

urarala with this sweet ass hair style would rock my whole world.
